othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Explains how users can subscribe to reports, set delivery frequency and manage subscription preferences.

ul.li: You must have access to the report. Before you can subscribe to a report, you must have permissions to generate it.

context.p: You can subscribe to reports, and subscribed reports will be delivered to the specified email addresses or will be saved in the specified file location. You can configure subscriptions such that reports can be delivered periodically in the format as specified.
Also, you can create multiple subscriptions for a single report with varied subscription options.

You can subscribe to a report by either of the following methods:
Email - The report is delivered by email to the specified email addresses in the specified formats.
File Share - The reports are saved to the specified location in the specified formats.

p.note: Any user with permission can subscribe themselves or others to a report. Only users with the Administrator role can remove or end an active subscription once created.

li.p: Open a report, and then click Subscribe.
The subscription dialog box is displayed.
In the Please select the delivery option section, perform either of the following steps:

ul.li: Click E-Mail to get the report delivered by email.
Click Windows File Share to save the report to the specified location.

li.p: Based on the delivery option selected, perform the following steps:

ol.li: In the To box, enter the email addresses of the recipients of the report.
In the Reply-To box, enter the email addresses of the recipients to whom the reply email must be delivered.
In the Subject box, enter the name of the report or any other appropriate subject for the email.

From the Priority drop-down list, select the priority of the email.
If the selected priority is High, the email will be sent as a High Priority notification.

In the Comment box, enter any comment for the email.
Comments are included in the body of the email.
Select the Include Report check box to deliver the report in the selected format as an email attachment.

Select the Include Link check box to deliver the link to the report in the report delivery email.
The recipient can view the report on the application only if the recipient has the required permissions on the report.
From the Report Format drop-down list, select the format the report must be generated and delivered to the specified email addresses.
From the Start Date list, click the date from when the report must be delivered.
Select the Stop this schedule on check box, and then select the date until when the report must be delivered.
In the File Name box, enter the file name for the report.
Select the Add a file extension when the file is created check box to save the report file name with the extension of the file format as required for the report.
In the Path box, enter the path of the shared file location where the report must be saved.
From the Report Format drop-down list, select the format the report must be generated and saved.
In the Credentials used to access the file share section, enter the credentials to access the shared location and save the report.

From the Overwrite options section, click any of the following options:
Overwrite an existing file with a newer version - When saving the report at the file location at the scheduled time, if a file with the same name exists, then the existing file is overwritten by the latest report.
Do not overwrite the file if a previous version exists - When saving the report at the file location at the scheduled time, if a file with the same name exists, then the report is not overwritten by the latest report, and the report is not saved at the file location.
Increment file names as newer versions are added - When saving the report at the file location at the scheduled time, if a file with the same name exists, then the latest report is saved with the same name appended with a sequential number.
From the Start Date list, click the date from when the report must be saved.
Select the Stop this schedule on check box, and then select the date up to when the report must be saved at the file location.

li.p: To set the frequency of report delivery, click the Schedule Details tab.
From the delivery frequency options, click the appropriate option:

row.entry: The report is delivered every preset number of hours.

ol.li: Click Hourly in the delivery options list.

In the Run the schedule every section, enter the frequency of report delivery:
In the hours and minutes boxes, enter the time period in hours and minutes the report must be periodically delivered.
In the Start time (hh:mm) box, enter the time (in 24-hour format) the report delivery must begin.

row.entry: The report is delivered once on preset days, or periodically as defined.

ol.li: Click Daily in the delivery options list.

In the schedule definition section, enter the frequency of report delivery:
Click Every Weekday to get the report delivered on all week days, that is from Monday to Friday.
Click Repeat after this number of days, and then, then in the box, enter the number of days to get the report delivered periodically once every specified number of days.
In the Start time (hh:mm) box, enter the time (in 24 hours format) the report must be delivered.

row.entry: The report is delivered every preset number of weeks on preset days of the week.

ol.li: Click Weekly in the delivery options list.
Click Repeat after this number of weeks, and then in the box, enter the number of weeks to get the report delivered periodically once every specified number of weeks.
In the On day(s) section, select the days on which the report must be delivered.
In the Start time (hh:mm) box, enter the time (in 24 hours format) the report must be delivered.

row.entry: The report is delivered monthly on preset days of a selected week.

ol.li: Click Monthly in the delivery options list.
Select the months when the report must be delivered.

Click one of the following options to schedule the delivery of the report:
On week of the month
From the list of weeks, select the week the report must be delivered.
In the On day(s) section, select the days the report must be delivered in the week previously selected.
On Calendar day(s)
In the box, enter the number of days of the month the report must be delivered, starting from the current day.
For example, if the current day is 12th of a month, and the calendar days set is 10, then the report is sent for 10 days from the 12th of every selected month.
In the Start time (hh:mm) box, enter the time (in 24 hours format) the report must be delivered.

row.entry: The report is delivered once on the current day.
In the Start time (hh:mm) box, enter the time, in 24 hours format, the report must be delivered.

li.p: The report is delivered as scheduled.

p.note: Users with administration permissions can unsubscribe to reports. For information on unsubscribing to reports, refer to Unsubscribing to a Report.
